item.title: Load Forecasting Control Method and System Of Chiller Based On Side-Cloud Collaborative Framework
item.description: The invention discloses a chiller load forecasting control method and system based on a side-cloud collaborative framework, and belongs to the field of optimized control. The present invention proposes a hierarchical optimization control of chillers using edge computing and cloud computing integration. Real-time load forecasting and division and data preprocessing at the edge, control parameter matrix under different load rates, training and updating of load forecasting models and energy consumption fitting models in the cloud, optimization of chiller control parame ters, using the corresponding models to pass intelligence The optimization algorithm seeks the input of the minimum value of the adaptive function to obtain the optimal control parameter combination. The invention makes full use of edge end resources for data preprocessing and control parameter matrix storage and control parameter transmission, reduces cloud computing pressure and reduces the impact of data transmission delay, so as to achieve the effect of rapid real-time update and optimization control, and can better Fitting the actual operating data, under the condition of meeting the basic load, significantly reducing the energy consumption of the entire system

item.title: A Waste Heat-Driven Absorption Refrigeration Auxiliary Subcooled CO2 Automobile Air Conditioner
item.description: The invention discloses a CO2 automobile air conditioner with waste heat driven absorption refrigeration and auxiliary subcooling. The high-temperature tail gas exhaust pipe of the internal combustion engine of the present invention is connected to the generator, the refrigerant vapor outlet of the generator, the condenser, the throttle valve one, and the refrigerant inlet of the evaporator one are connected in sequence, and the refrigerant outlet of the evaporator one, the absorber, and the The solution pump and the solution inlet of the heat exchanger are connected in sequence, and the solution outlet of the heat exchanger is connected to the generator; the refrigerant outlet of the generator is connected to the refrigerant inlet of the heat exchanger, and the refrigerant outlet of the heat exchanger is connected to the absorber through the second throttle valve. ; The compressor outlet is connected to the throttle valve through the gas cooler and connected to the compressor inlet. The present invention is to cool the CO2 at the outlet of the gas cooler, the evaporation temperature of which is higher, higher than the evaporation temperature of the CO2 system, and the two systems are coordinated and matched with each other to jointly improve the overall efficiency of the cycle

item.title: CO2 Marine Refrigeration System With Subcooling Assisted By Absorption and Thermoelectric Refrigeration
item.description: The invention discloses a CO2 marine refrigeration system with absorption and thermoelectric refrigeration in cooperation with auxiliary subcooling. The solution outlet of the absorber of the present invention is connected to the solution inlet of the generator through a solution pump, the refrigerant vapor outlet of the generator is connected to the second refrigerant inlet of the evaporator through a condenser and a pressure reducing valve, and the second refrigerant outlet of the evaporator is connected to the absorber; The absorber is connected through a throttle valve; the compressor outlet, gas cooler, thermoelectric subcooler, evaporator two, expander and evaporator one inlet are connected in sequence, and the evaporator one outlet is connected to the compressor inlet; the power manager is connected to the expansion separately Machine and thermoelectric supercooler. The invention can cool the CO2 at the outlet of the gas cooler by recycling the waste heat and pressure, is easy to realize, and can reduce its temperature below the ambient temperature, and can significantly reduce the irreversible loss in the high-pressure CO2 throttling process

item.title: A CO2 Automobile Air-Conditioning System Based On Waste Heat And Pressure Combined With Auxiliary Subcooling
item.description: The invention discloses a CO2 automobile air conditioning system based on waste heat and pressure combined with auxiliary subcooling. The CO2 automobile air conditioning system of the present invention includes a compressor, an evaporator, a gas cooler, a throttle valve, a thermoelectric generator, a thermoelectric subcooler, a thermoelectric generator and an engine; the evaporator outlet is connected to the compressor inlet, and the compressor outlet is connected to gas cooling The inlet of the gas cooler and the outlet of the gas cooler are connected to the inlet of the thermoelectric subcooler, the outlet of the thermoelectric subcooler is connected to the inlet of the throttle valve, the outlet of the expander is connected to the inlet of the evaporator; the outlet of the engine gas pipe is connected to the thermoelectric generator, and the expander is connected to the power manager, power management The generators are respectively connected to the thermoelectric subcooler and the thermoelectric generator. The invention uses the temperature difference between the high-temperature tail gas and the ambient air to output electric energy, which is used to drive the thermoelectric supercooler and improves the utilization rate of energy.

item.title: A CO2 Automotive Air Conditioning System Based On Waste Heat and Subcooling
item.description: The invention discloses a CO2 automobile air conditioning system based on waste heat and supercooling. The CO2 automobile air conditioning system of the present invention includes a compressor, an evaporator, a gas cooler, a throttle valve, a thermoelectric generator, a thermoelectric subcooler, a thermoelectric generator and an engine; the evaporator outlet is connected to the compressor inlet, and the compressor outlet is connected to gas cooling The inlet and outlet of the gas cooler are connected to the inlet of the thermoelectric subcooler, the outlet of the thermoelectric subcooler is connected to the inlet of the throttle valve, and the outlet of the throttle valve is connected to the inlet of the evaporator; the outlet of the engine gas pipe is connected to a thermoelectric generator, and the power manager is connected to the thermoelectric subcooler respectively. And thermoelectric generator. The invention uses the temperature difference between the high-temperature tail gas and the ambient air to output electric energy, which is used to drive the thermoelectric supercooler and improves the utilization rate of energy.
